item.title: E300 Econometric Methods
item.description: E300 Econometric Methods Zoom Revision Class Date and Time: April 22, 9-11 am BST Venue: Zoom Material: Chapter 36 “Large sample estimation and hypothesis testing” in the Handbook of Econometrics by Newey and McFadden(1994). Office Hours Thursdays, 17.00 - 18.00, starting this week, at the following locations: Oct. 17 - Supervision Room 1 Oct. 24 - Supervision Room 1 Oct. 31 - Supervision Room 1 Nov. 7 - Meade Room Nov.

item.title: F400 Asset Pricing
item.description: F400 Asset Pricing Office Hours Wednesday 5-6 pm 13th Feb, Supervision room 1; 20th Feb, Meade room; 27th Feb, Supervision room 2; 6th March, Supervision room 2; 13th March, Marshall room; 20th March, Supervision Room 1. Supplementary Materials Details on Computing the Certainty Equivalence in Chapter 2 Details on Black-Scholes Derivation Details on Finding the Term Structure Equation Solution to Vasicek Model

item.title: Paper 6 Banking and Finance
item.description: Paper 6 Banking and Finance About different channels Link to Bernanke speech Financial accelerator: changes in financial and credit conditions are important in the propagation of the business cycle, a mechanism that has been dubbed the “financial accelerator.” Credit channel: changes in financial conditions may amplify the effects of monetary policy on the economy, the so-called credit channel of monetarypolicy transmission. Credit channel works through (wiki link) Balance sheet channel Bank lending channel Models CSV model CE model Both models can show the financial acceleartor and the credit channel: roughly speaking, the models predict/explain that when a shock happens, it will be amplified through the banking system because banks will change credit rationing behaviour.
